page.shortlink: api pdf fillinfields merge function source
page.description: Merges data into a PDF file that has fill-in fields, creating a new PDF file with the filled in data. You can use the pdf_fillinFields_get() function to get the name of the fill-in fields in the PDF file.

prototypes.prototype: dim result as L = pdf_fillinFields_merge(pdfFileIn as C, pdfFileOut as C, JSONData as C [, storageConnectionString as C [, s3ObjectName as C]])

argument.name: pdfFileIn
argument.description: The PDF file containing the fill-in fields.

description.p: The name of the PDF file to create or *[xb:"AmazonS3"]*.
If a filename is specified, the filename must include the name and path for the new PDF file created after merging the JSON data into the PDF file.
If *[xb:"AmazonS3"]* is specified, the *[xb:storageConnectionString]* and *[xb:s3ObjectName]* must also be defined.

argument.name: JSONData
argument.description: A JSON object that defines the values to populate the fields in *[xb:pdfFileIn]*.

description.p: A storage connection string to an S3 bucket where the output file will be uploaded. Required if *[xb:pdfFileOut]* is set to *[xb:"AmazonS3"]*
Only required if *[xb:pdfFileOut]* is set to *[xb:"AmazonS3"]*. The name of the object on S3 where the output file will be uploaded.

return.name: result
return.description: Returns *[xb:.T.]* if the operation succeeds, otherwise *[xb:.F.]*.

description.p: The field values that you use in the JSON data must match the defined 'Export value' in the PDF form. In the PDF form designer, you can specify an 'export value' for each field. In the Example shown below, the 'Export value' for the 'football', 'baseball' and 'basketball' fields was defined as 'Yes'.

section.example:
dim jsonData as c jsonData = <<%str% { "first_name": "Fred", "last_name": "Smith", "date": "12/18/2003", "football": "Yes", "baseball": "Yes", "basketball": "Off" } %str%
dim pdfIn as c dim pdfOut as c pdfIn = "c:\mypdffiles\pdfform1.pdf" pdfOut = "c:\mypdffiles\pdfform1_filled.pdf"
pdf_fillinFields_merge(pdfIn,pdfOut,jsonData)
